summary: Hoover Dam is a huge concrete dam on the Colorado River, between Nevada and Arizona. It was built during the Great Depression (1931-1936) and named after President Herbert Hoover. The dam controls floods, provides water, and generates electricity. Its construction was challenging and dangerous, involving thousands of workers. Despite difficulties, it was finished ahead of schedule. Today, Hoover Dam attracts 7 million tourists yearly and is a key power source for Nevada, Arizona, and California.
title: Hoover Dam
